newsitem.title: USA: HCIA boosted by confidence on Q1 results.
newsitem.headline: HCIA boosted by confidence on Q1 results.

text.p: Shares in health care information provider HCIA Inc rose Tuesday, boosted by confidence about quarterly results, analysts said.
HCIA was up 2-5/8, or almost 16 percent, to 19-3/8 in mid-afternoon. Volume was 620,200 shares, more than twice average daily activity.
"The stock has been under a lot of pressure lately," said Ann Gallo, an analyst at Alex. Brown in Baltimore.
"The nice upturn that you see today is that the negative was overdone and the quarter is on track."
Since mid-February the shares have skidded despite no news about the company. They fell from about 41 to reach 16-3/4, close to a 12-month low at the end of March.

Steven Halper, an analyst at Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette, said investors might have been encouraged by lack of an preliminary statement about first quarter earnings. The quarter ended Monday and HCIA will announce results April 30.

Most analysts have predicted HCIA will report first quarter earnings per share of $0.19 or $0.20. Halper expects $0.23 and Gallo $0.21, and earnings per share for the first quarter last year were $0.14.
